t: For the choir director: on Mahalath. A Maskil of David.
The*pn fool says in his heart, “There’s no God.” They*ln are corrupt, and they do vile deeds. There*ln is no one who does good.
God*ln looks down from heaven on the human race to*ln see if there is one who is wise, one*ln who seeks God.
All*ln have turned away; all*ln alike have become corrupt. There*ln is no one who does good, not*ln even one.
Will*pn evildoers never understand? They*ln consume my people as they consume bread; they*ln do not call on God.
Then*ln they will be filled with dread — dread*ln like no other— because*ln God will scatter the*ln bones of those who besiege you. You*ln will put them to shame, for*ln God has rejected them.
Oh,*pn that Israel’s deliverance would come from Zion! When*ln God restores the fortunes of his people, let*ln Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.
